hero.headline: YouTube Microphone Guide
hero.subheadline: Audio quality matters more than video. Get it right.

sections.content: Viewers tolerate mediocre video but click away from bad audio. Clear audio keeps people watching; poor audio makes your content feel amateur. The right microphone depends on your setup, environment, and content type. Here's how to choose.

faq.question: Best budget microphone for YouTube?
faq.answer: Fifine K669 or similar USB mics under $50 are surprisingly good. Blue Snowball at $50-70 classic choice. Rode NT-USB Mini excellent mid-range. Start budget, upgrade when warranted.

faq.question: USB or XLR microphone?
faq.answer: USB simpler—plug into computer and go. XLR higher quality ceiling but needs audio interface. Most YouTubers fine with USB. XLR for podcasts, voiceover, professional work.

faq.question: How to reduce echo and room noise?
faq.answer: Record in smaller room if possible. Soft furnishings absorb sound—carpets, curtains, furniture help. Foam panels on walls effective. Closets make great vocal booths. Blankets work in a pinch.

faq.question: Why does my audio sound bad?
faq.answer: Common issues: mic too far away, gain too high causing distortion, room echo, handling noise. Get mic closer, lower gain, treat room, use shock mount. Most problems are setup not gear.
